CatDescriptText: Charles Pinkston, 2516 Breckinridge Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "I really do because I think that if the city took over, it would eliminate the trolleys and put on buses. This in turn would eliminate the bottlenecks that we have."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Pinkston wearing a light colored hat, moustache, and zippered jacket, standing in front of light colored backdrop
